event.title: 1637, the Pequot people had been driven

data.event: In 1637, the Pequot people had been driven from their former homes in Connecticut and settled in what is now Dover.
In 1637, the Pequot people had been driven from their former homes in Connecticut and settled in what is now Dover.
The town was formed in 1807 from part of the town of Pawling.

event.title: now an inn and restaurant known

data.event: That home, built circa 1730, is now an inn and restaurant known as Old Drovers Inn.
When the center was closed in 1994, many businesses in the area were hit hard.
The property and buildings were purchased in 2003 by the Benjamin Development Corporation, and the eastern portion was sold to Olivet Management in 2013.
